density.note: Pure H₂O₂ is denser than water; household 3% solution is ~1.01 kg/L (close to water)

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: High heat of vaporization, though less than water (2257 kJ/kg)

evaporationCoefficient.note: Hertz-Knudsen α coefficient. Low due to strong hydrogen bonding similar to water. Range 0.01-1.0.

antoineCoefficients.TminC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MINIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated down to this temperature. Calculations below this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.TmaxC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MAXIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated up to this temperature. Calculations above this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.source: Published thermodynamic data for hydrogen peroxide vapor pressure; lower than water at equivalent temperatures due to molecular structure.
antoineCoefficients.note: Lower vapor pressure than water at same temperature

electricalConductivity.note: Very poor conductor when pure; slight autodissociation

decomposition.note: Decomposes exothermically; stored in dark bottles with stabilizers

solubilityInWater.note: Fully miscible; forms hydrogen bonds with water
